# King Midas' Ears

]]
'''King Midas' Ears' () is an opera in two acts, a satirical work by Ferit Tüzün who composed it from 1966 to 1969. It is set to a libretto in Turkish by . It premiered at State Opera in Istanbul in 1969.
The opera is based on part of the myth of Midas.
Roles
*Midas, baritone
*Barber, speaking role
*Apollon, bass
*Pan, tenor
